config.question: Why did President Monroe welcome the British initiative against the Grand Alliance?

choices.content: He wanted to play the European powers against each other.
He wanted to eliminate Russia’s influence along the Pacific coast.
He was eager to help defeat France.
He had expansionist plans of his own, involving South America.

answer_3.response: Monroe welcomed the British initiative because he believed the United States should take an active role in transatlantic affairs by playing one European power against another.
